item.title: Japan Discharge of Fukushima Radioactive Water Into Pacific Gets Green Light
item.description: The IAEA said Japan’s plan was safe and in line with similar discharges carried out by nations around the world that operate nuclear-power plants.

item.title: Volkswagen Outlines Brazilian Growth Plan
item.description: Volkswagen said it will invest €1 billion by 2026 in Brazil, where it plans to grow by 40% in the next several years.

item.title: SoftBank's Son Envisions AI Eventually Being Used in Every Industry
item.description: SoftBank Group Chief Executive Masayoshi Son said artificial intelligence would be overwhelmingly smarter than the human brain and could eventually be used in any industry.

item.title: Dollar Stays Steady for Now, Vulnerable to Jobs Data on Friday
item.description: The dollar was steady with U.S. markets closed and as traders awaited Wednesday’s Fed minutes and Friday’s jobs data—which might give clues on further interest-rate rises.

item.title: Oil Inches Higher as Macro Environment Dominates Over Fundamentals
item.description: Crude futures gained, with price movements recently more aligned with the macro environment than supply and demand fundamentals, according to ING.

item.title: Metals Mixed Over Economic Uncertainty
item.description: Base metals were mixed, with gold a touch higher, as worries over the global economy continued to dampen demand.

item.title: Eurozone Government Bond Supply Seen Under EUR100 Bln in July
item.description: Government supply in the eurozone is expected to amount to €97 billion in July, the lowest monthly supply year to date in 2023, Citi said.

item.title: China Restricts Exports of Two Minerals Used in High-Performance Chips
item.description: Industry executives see Beijing’s export ban on gallium and germanium as retaliation over chip curbs by the U.S. and others.

item.title: Germany's Trade Surplus Falls on Weaker Exports
item.description: German exports unexpectedly fell 0.1% in May, although imports rose, a sign that domestic demand could be improving despite a global economic slowdown.

item.title: Sainsbury's Backs Outlook as Sales Rise
item.description: Sainsbury’s confirmed its full-year profit guidance after reporting a 9.8% rise in first-quarter same-store sales and said U.K. food inflation was starting to fall.

item.title: Casino Gets Offers to Boost Capital
item.description: Casino has received two proposals to strengthen its capital base, with the offers from EP Global and Fimalac and 3F Holding both . being considered.

item.title: How to Start Accounting for Carbon
item.description: Holcim, HP and Nestlé sustainability executives offer simple steps to get started.

item.title: China's Chip Industry Braces for Further Sanctions With Concerns and Defiance
item.description: At an annual semiconductor-industry conference in Shanghai, U.S. export restrictions are a major topic.

item.title: Adidas Turnaround Helped by Samba Shoe, Margin Tailwinds
item.description: Adidas is only at the beginning of a multiyear turnaround story that will be helped by the Samba shoe’s surging popularity and favorable margin dynamics, Berenberg said, which estimates the company could return to a 7.5% margin by the end of 2024.

item.title: RBA Stands Pat on Rates to Assess Economic Outlook
item.description: The Reserve Bank of Australia left official interest rate on hold saying that the decision gives it time to further assess the mixed economic outlook.

item.title: South Korea Trims 2023 GDP, Inflation Forecasts
item.description: Economic growth is projected to undershoot the South Korean government’s earlier estimate due to sluggish exports in the first half of this year.

item.title: Spider-Man's Pavitr Prabhakar, Based on Peter Parker, Drives India Wild
item.description: The world’s most movie-crazy country is ecstatic over the Sony hit, and what’s considered to be the first Indian superhero in an American blockbuster

item.title: U.S. Looks to Restrict China's Access to Cloud Computing to Protect Advanced Technology
item.description: The Biden administration proposal, aimed at closing a loophole in chip export controls, could escalate a tit-for-tat fight with Beijing.

item.title: New FTC Guidelines Could Prompt Marketers, Influencers to Revisit Endorsement Practices
item.description: Updated guidelines clarify what amounts to a proper disclosure of a promotional agreement.

item.title: The Ukraine War Is Tearing Apart the West's Largest Russian Diaspora
item.description: Moscow’s propaganda targeting Russian speakers has carved a rift through families, pitching people across generations and backgrounds against one another.
